meanings.sent1: I kow the ball with my foot.
meanings.sent2: She kows the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef will kow the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The waves kow against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: He kows the drum to create a rhythm.

meanings.definition: A sound made by a cow
meanings.sent1: The kow of the cow echoed through the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud kow coming from the barn.
meanings.sent3: The kow of the cow interrupted the peaceful morning.
meanings.sent4: The kow of the cow was music to the farmer's ears.
meanings.sent5: The kow of the cow signaled milking time.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Laos
meanings.sent1: He exchanged his dollars for kow to use in Laos.
meanings.sent2: The market only accepted kow for the goods.
meanings.sent3: She saved up enough kow for a special souvenir.
meanings.sent4: The value of kow fluctuated in the foreign exchange market.
meanings.sent5: The kow in his wallet allowed him to buy local delicacies.
